bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing geoclue from 'read' accesses on the file cpuinfo.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: SELinux is preventing geoclue from 'read' accesses on the file cpuinfo.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that geoclue should be allowed read access on the cpuinfo file by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'geoclue' --raw | audit2allow -M my-geoclue # semodule -X 300 -i my-geoclue.pp
Additional Information: Source Context system_u:system_r:geoclue_t:s0 Target Context system_u:object_r:proc_t:s0 Target Objects cpuinfo [ file ] Source geoclue Source Path geoclue Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-220.fc25.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Enforcing Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.8.4-301.fc25.armv7hl #1 SMP Tue Oct 25 02:01:39 UTC 2016 armv7l armv7l Alert Count 17 First Seen 2016-10-26 11:59:26 BST Last Seen 2016-10-27 13:31:16 BST Local ID 30d47ddf-a287-49f5-be2a-90ac1c242560
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1477571476.895:224): avc: denied { read } for pid=2451 comm="geoclue" name="cpuinfo" dev="proc" ino=4026532358 scontext=system_u:system_r:geoclue_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:proc_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=0
Hash: geoclue,geoclue_t,proc_t,file,read
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-220.fc25.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.8.0 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.4-301.fc25.armv7hl type: libreport
selinux-policy-3.13.1-222.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-d1908bac81

selinux-policy-3.13.1-222.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-d1908bac81
